history.provenance: Murbach, Benedictine abbey: inscription 'Legentes in hoc libro orent pro reverendo domino Bartholomeo de Andolo cuius industria pene dilapssus renouatus est anno MCCCCLXI' (fol. 103v).
Marcus Zuerius Boxhorn, Leiden (d. 1653): ownership inscription 'Sum Boxhorni' (fol. 2r)

recordHist.source:
Description adapted by Tuija Ainonen (April 2020) from the following sources (with additional description of contents):
Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library Oxford, 3 vols. (1966-1973) I, nos. 1, 22, 2, 5, pl. I. [Parts 1-5: decoration, localization and date] Unpublished description by Stephen Mossman, c. 2003. B. Bischoff, Katalog der festländischen Handschriften des neunten Jahrhunderts, II, pp. 364-66, Nos. 3799-3808.
Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 969 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 970 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 971

availability.p: To ensure its availability to future readers, access to this item is restricted, and readers are asked to work from reproductions and published descriptions as far as possible. To apply to see the original, please send a message to specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk, outlining the subject of your research, the importance of this item to that research, and the resources you have already consulted.

Handschriftencensus: Eine Bestandsaufnahme der handschriftlichen Überlieferung deutschsprachiger Texte des Mittelalters
JONAS: Répertoire des textes et des manuscrits médiévaux d'oc et d'oïl

msItem.title: Hymns
msItem.note: neumed
Fragments, bound sideways. Many smaller fragments slightly visible between various folios.

msItem.author: Ps.-Aethicus
msItem.title: Cosmographia
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber ethici translato philosophico edito oraculo Hieronimo presbytero dilatum ex chosmografia id est mundi scriptura edicta ethici philosophi chosmografi
msItem.incipit: Philosophorum sciedolas sagacei indagatione
msItem.explicit: quos nos indaganter inuestigauimus. Suos characteres litterarum quos adinuenit ita distinxit
msItem.note: Followed by 22 'letters' and their names in three columns.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber ethici philosophi cosmografi, natione schitica, nobile prosapia parentum, ab eo enim ethica philosophia a reliquis sapientibus originem traxit.
msItem.note: CLA II.242; Earlier Latin Manuscripts, https://elmss.nuigalway.ie/catalogue/561 [accessed 16 April 2020].

origin.origPlace: German, Southwest Murbach, Benedictine abbey(?) (Bischoff, II, no. 3799)

msItem.note: Various short notes and glosses in Latin, some containing Greek, on an originally blank folio.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: Rhetoric
msItem.rubric: Qui rogo ciuiles cupiat cognoscere mores haec percepta legat quaelibet iste.
msItem.incipit: Quia te venerande magister Deus adduxit et reduxit
msItem.note: The treatise ends in a series of diagrammes, fols. 72v-75v.
Small stubs of excized folios between fols. 71-72 (stubb contains neumes, text written sideways), 74-75, and 75-76.
ed. PL 101, col. 919ff.

msItem.author: Isidore of Seville
msItem.title: Letter to Masso
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola sancti Ysidori episcopi directa ad Massonem episcopum
msItem.incipit: Domino sancto ... Veniente ad nos

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: Dialectic
msItem.incipit: Quia mentionem philosophiae in priore disputationis
msItem.note: ed. PL 101, col. 951ff.

msItem.author: Ps.-Jerome
msItem.title: De generibus musicorum
msItem.rubric: Epitola Ieronimi ad Dardanum de generibus musicorum. Incipit cum sua interpretatione.
msItem.incipit: Cogor a te ut tibi Dardane de aliis generibus musicorum

handDesc.handNote: At least two different hands writing in Caroline minuscule.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: Carmen
msItem.incipit: O rex auguste clarissime dignus honore et dux et doctor
msItem.note: Added in the 10th century on previously empty folio.
ed. Ernst Dümmler, Poetae Latini aevi Carolini, MGH, Poetae latini, vol. 1, p. 300 no. 82.
Followed by another unidentified hymn on 18 lines.

msItem.title: Glossary ('Junius B')
msItem.incipit:
Abram pater excelsus hohfater
Abram pater multorum
msItem.explicit: Uncia uam unicus cuius que rei xii. pars sicut est uncia in libra
msItem.note: The glossary is constructed from glosses to the Biblical books Genesis – I Kings, with additional glosses (usually marked with ał) included from the Homilies of Gregory the Great. Each letter of alphabet starts a new column.
CLA II. 243.

msItem.title: Glossary to the Dialogues of Gregory the Great
msItem.note: Added in to the free spaces left in the glossary 'Junius B', and is in a different hand from either of those of that glossary; it is found on fols. 89ra, 91ra, 92rb, 93ra-b, 94ra and 102rb.
The German parts of both of these glossaries in Manuscript 4 are edited in: Steinmeyer, Elias, and Eduard Sievers (eds.), Die althochdeutschen Glossen, 5 vols (Berlin 1879-1922), no. 493.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in two columns, c. 24-25 lines, unruled.

origin.origDate: 8th century, end-9th century, beginning (Bischoff, II, no. 3801)
Some glosses added at Murbach abbey, early 9th century (BStK Online: https://glossen.germ-ling.uni-bamberg.de/manuscripts/12918 [accessed 16 April 2020])
Hymn, added 9th century, first quarter (BStK Online: https://glossen.germ-ling.uni-bamberg.de/manuscripts/12918 [accessed 16 April 2020])
origin.origPlace: A Germanic centre in the region of Lake Constance (Bischoff, II, no. 3801)

msItem.author: Venantius Fortunatus
msItem.title: Commentary on the Athanasian Creed
msItem.incipit: Quicumque vult salvus esse ... Fides dicitur credulitas sive credentia

msItem.author: Pelagius
msItem.title: Libellus fidei ad Innocentium papam
msItem.incipit: Credimus in Deum patrem omnipotentem, cunctorum visibilium et invisibilium conditorem ...
msItem.explicit: non me ereticum conprobabit. Dolendum est non querere homines eterna quae certa sunt sed sperare.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.incipit: Pater noster qui es in caelis; haec vox libertatis est
msItem.explicit: Sed libera nos a malo; a diabolo vel a malis hominibus.

msItem.title: Commentary on the Lord's Prayer
msItem.incipit: Pater noster qui in caelis es. Patrem dicendo se filios confitentur
msItem.explicit: Recte ergo et hii quibus peccata dimittuntur homines appellati sunt.
msItem.textLang: Latin, with a couple of Greek words

origin.origPlace: German, Murbach, Benedictine abbey (Bischoff, II, no. 3802)

msItem.title: Hymns
msItem.incipit: euuige tes lon intj urchundono kauuirich
Aeterna Christi munera et martyrum uictoria
msItem.explicit: ni si kiskentit in euun
non confundar in eternum
msItem.note: ‘Murbacher Hymnen’, nos. 22–26. These hymns are written with the Old High German translations directly above the Latin texts, in a Murbach hand of the early 9th century.
Ed. in Steinmeyer, Elias, and Eduard Sievers (eds.), Die althochdeutschen Glossen, 5 vols (Berlin 1879-1922), no. 493.
msItem.textLang: Latin with Old High German glosses

msItem.title: Glossary ('Junius C')
msItem.incipit:
ortfrumo
thara uuidri
em mizi

Auctor
At contra
Assiduitate
msItem.explicit: uuint linder in uuintar

Zephiri lenes uent
que uerno tempore
msItem.note: In the same hand as the scribe of the hymns also present in this manuscript; in four columns, arranged alphabetically, but leaping from D to M as the central bifolium of the quire has fallen out. There are one or two additions in the same hand as those on 89r – 102v.
Ed. in Krotz, Elke, Auf den Spuren des althochdeutschen Isidor: Studien zur Pariser Handschrift, den Mondseer Fragmenten und zum Glossar Jc (Munich 2000), pp. 159-259.

layoutDesc.layout: Hymns written on 25 long lines, with interlinear German glosses.

origin.origPlace: German, Murbach, Benedictine abbey (Bischoff, II, no. 3803)

msItem.title: Glossary to the Benedictine Rule
msItem.incipit:
kizogenen lungorun
kispreitta

Alumnis
Propagium
msItem.explicit: Priuata
kiskerita
msItem.note: In the same hand as the previous glossary. The text begins on 122r (that is, on the first leaf of the 7th part in the composite), before breaking off midway through the fifth column. It then continues in the left hand margin of 121v, then in the free space in the fourth column of 121v, and finally returns to the free space in the fifth column of 122r. In the initial columns on 122r, the German equivalents are entered above the Latin. After the break midway in the fifth column, however, the Latin is entered not in full Carolingian minuscule, but in the same hand used for entering the German text, and so the German text occurs sometimes above, sometimes alongside and sometimes below the Latin terms thereafter. (Mossman, c. 2003)
A subsequent hand has entered a tiny portion of a different glossary to the Benedictine Rule in the bottom right-hand corner of fol. 122r. (Mossmann, c. 2003).
Ed. in Steinmeyer, Elias, and Eduard Sievers (eds.), Die althochdeutschen Glossen, 5 vols (Berlin 1879-1922), no. 493.
msItem.textLang: Latin and Old High German for glosses

msItem.title: Hymns
msItem.note: 'Murbacher hymnen' nos. 1-21, cum versione Theotisca
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt hymni canendae per circulum anni hymnum ad noctem dominicis diebus
msItem.incipit: mit tera nahti zite uuizacl lichiu stimma manot
Mediae noctis tempore prophetica uox admonet
msItem.explicit: fona allemu todes analaufte dinan kascirmi liut
ab omni mortis inpetu tuum defendas populum
msItem.note: These are in a different hand from those hymns of part 6, although organised in the same manner upon the page, with the Old High German text above the Latin. (Mossman, c. 2003).

The text edited in Eduard Sievers, Die Murbacher Hymnen (Halle 1874); Paul Piper, Nachträge zur älteren deutschen Litteratur, Deutsches National-Litteratur 162 (Stuttgart 1898), pp. 165-85; Cyrille Vogel, ‘L’hymnaire de Murbach contenu dans le manuscrit Junius 25’, Archives de l’Eglise d’Alsace 25 (1958), 1-42, here pp. 18-42; Ursula, Daab, Drei Reichenauer Denkmäler der altalemannische Frühzeit, Altdeutsches Textbibliothek 57 (Tübingen 1963), pp. 29-76.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 20 long lines, with interlinear German glosses.

msItem.title: Grammatical forms
msItem.incipit: Uidentur uerba et forma gerendi perfecto in passiuum uersa per qualitatem
msItem.explicit: utinam latus essem.
msItem.note: Fols. 130r, 133v blank.
Bischoff, II, no. 3805.

origin.origDate: First quarter of 9th century (Bischoff, II, no. 3805).

msItem.author: Isidore
msItem.title: Etymologies
msItem.incipit: Domino meo et Dei seruo
msItem.note: Followed by a list of chapter titles for book 1.
msItem.incipit: Disciplina a discendo nomen accepit
msItem.explicit: et quintiliano sed ita copiose ita uarie ut eadem lectori
msItem.note: Incomplete, books 1-2,2; text ends abruptly on fol. 151v, that contains only two lines, rest is blank.

Includes isolated Old High German glosses, both marginal and interlinear, on fols. 137r, 147v and 148v. The glosses are edited in Steinmeyer, Elias, and Eduard Sievers (eds.), Die althochdeutschen Glossen, 5 vols (Berlin 1879-1922), no. 493.
Bischoff, II, no. 3806.
msItem.textLang: Latin; glosses in Old High German

handDesc.handNote: Caroline minuscule, written by several 9th century hands (BStK: https://glossen.germ-ling.uni-bamberg.de/manuscripts/12920 [accessed 16 April 2020]).

msItem.author: Petrus Pisanus
msItem.title: Ars grammatica
msItem.note: excerpts from recension b, based on Donatus, De octo partibus-De interiectione
msItem.incipit: Donatus dicit partes orationis sunt octo
msItem.explicit: De interiectione ... nec in aliam linguum facile transferentur.
msItem.note: followed by excerpts from another unidentified text on grammar

msItem.incipit: Sunt nomina tota mobilia ut doctus .ta .tum. Et ideo mobilia dicuntur
msItem.explicit: Lucius uero ait: cumque hic tam formosus homo apta dignius puellus

msItem.note: Bischoff, II, vol. 2, no. 3807.

msItem.author: Claudius Claudianus (?)
msItem.title: Carmina minora
msItem.note: Car. 32: De salvatore
msItem.incipit: Christe potens rerum redeuntis conditor aevi
msItem.explicit: Annua sinceri celebrent ieiunia sacri
msItem.note: followed by three lines titled "Dedodagrico"

origin.origDate: end of the 8th century-beginning of 9th century (Bischoff, II, no. 3807)

msItem.title: Glossary ('Junius A')
msItem.note: to a substantial part of the Bible
msItem.incipit: Bresith hebreum nomen Genesis grecum in lacmadis generatio Prologus prefatio siue proloquutio
msItem.explicit:
Penetrare ingan
Aporia suintilod
Diuinatio urteili
msItem.note: Ed. in Steinmeyer, Elias, and Eduard Sievers (eds.), Die althochdeutschen Glossen, 5 vols (Berlin 1879-1922), no. 493.

msItem.title: Theological texts
msItem.note: Various excerpts, Expositiones orationis dominicae et symboli

msItem.author: Isidore of Seville
msItem.title: Etymologies
msItem.note: Excerpts from Book VII.6-Book VIII.2

msItem.rubric: De nominibus qui de quodam presagio nomina acceperunt
msItem.incipit: Plerique primorum hominorum
Quorundam patriarcharum ethimologiae notandae sunt
Quos gentiles uater apellant
Martyres greca lingua latine testes dicuntur
Cleros et clericos hinc appellatos
Monachus greca ethimologia uocatur eo quod sit singularis
Christianus quantum de interpretatio
Ecclesia grecum est quod in lation uertitur conuocatio
msItem.explicit: quasi inter Deum et hominem hinc et fedus.

msItem.incipit: Dominus et saluator noster discipulis suis petentibus quemadmodum orare deberent
Petr noster qui es in caelis; ut filius esse merearis ecclesiae
Auscultate expositionem de fide catholica

origin.origDate: end of the 8th century-beginning of 9th century (Bischoff, II, no. 3808)
origin.origPlace: German, Lake Constance region (?) (Bischoff, II, no. 3808)
